column4: Hey, if anyone has a moment, I'm a brand new Ubuntu user and I'm having some problems.
Well, I'm trying to install the Nvidia drivers for my 7600. Everytime I do this, I get crazy errors, or it flat-out doesn't work.
how are you tyring to install them?
just open a terminal and sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx
please try my suggestion first installing the nvidia-glx package and tell me if you get any errors
yes, did it say something aobut nvidia kernel module could not be loaded?
yeah you can get it to load gui are you able to chat on here on a seperate computer so you can work on the other wone?
or are you able to mount the hard drive to edit files on it?
I'll just reinstall Ubunto while I'm in the chat. Then when I reboot, I'll enter the chat again.
you don't need to reinstall it can be fixed with out doing that.
click on places do you see your hard drive that you installed to in there?
I do not see my harddrive.
okay open a terminal and type in fdisk -l
and do you have windows on the drive or just linux?
okay how many lines long was the response from fdisk -l?
can you pastebin the results?  It would speed up the process.
is there any way we can use AIM?
